abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. Lessons stipulate that
            significant steps to support the transition to a market
            economy, and stability of macroeconomic conditions were
            taken, through measures to support emerging market
            conditions in the transport sector. However, the economic
            stability remained fragile, and the country faces severe
            foreign exchange constraints, leading to shortage of
            essential products, including fuel. Thus, the high transport
            cost reduces the value added to GDP from the export of its
            principal products, and, revenue of transport enterprises is
            diluted by inflation, weakening the financial sustainability
            of operations. In addition, the urban transport management
            needs to be seen comprehensively: the rate of attrition of
            buses, and trolleys procured under the project is alarming,
            bus utilization is low, and, among the factors contributing
            to this rapid depreciation, are the difficult climatic and
            road conditions, excessive over loadings, declining revenue,
            and rising operating costs. To this end, the Bank may
            consider assistance in developing a sustainable urban
            transport policy. Conversely, while foundation towards
            institutional strengthening, and capacity building has been
            set, and the private sector exposed to international
            standards in construction management, there is strong felt
            need to deepen the skill, and knowledge transfer through
            joint participation, and hands-on experience, for future
            project sustainability.
